column4: I watched my first NHL game Toronto vs. Senators. Even though the Maple Leafs lost, the atmosphere was lot of fun, good people. Impressed by the whole stadium and staff who work during the game day. However met some nerds in the morning working there and wouldnt even help understand when the game is being played or who is coming.....
Always fun to go to a Leafs Game. Lots of excitement. The staff and ushers are very friendly. Food and beverage is outrageously priced, I would recommend you eat before you go.
The Air Canada Centre is a great destination for many sporting events, parking is usually ok the only draw back can be the traffic both before and after the game don't be in a rush

We saw the Bulls vs Raptors at the ACC and it is an amazing arena! Finding our seats in the top tier (300 levels) was easy and getting good and drinks was also very easy.You can drink in your seats, which allows for a bit more enjoyment.This is one of the better NBA arenas I've been too!
Been to many NHL arenas and this is by far one of my favorites. Great sight lines, great acustics. The fact my Blackhawks won made it even better.

We were given free tickets to the Leafs-Flyers game March 9 - face value was $136 for "greens" up high in the corner. Even for free it seemed like poor value for our entertainment dollar. The seats are tiny and cramped. The access in and around the ACC is crowded and difficult. The quality of hockey is so bad and...

Went to a Leafs game, which wasn't bad, but I much prefer Junior hockey, more action and effort I think. The air canada centre..... hard to get to, parking a premium, FOOD concessions way too expensive as well as the beer. An example, you can buy 24 bottles of water at No Frills for 1.99. and a bottle of water...

Was here for three mathces in late february 17. Both Maple Leafs and Raptors. Great atmosphere, plenty of kiosks and very helpful staff! People told me it was very expensive inside ACC. Coming from Norway, it didn't really feel that expensive.

The ACC is a great place for concerts, etc. as it holds a lot of people. But getting around and finding your seats, etc. is too much. If you are planning on attending a concert here - book a local hotel room and cab it. What a nightmare getting out! And parking - no way.
Enjoyed the experience of seeing the Toronto Raptors play basketball in this wonderful stadium. if you are a sports fan, it is worth the visit to see Ice Hockey or Basketball

What an amazing opportunity we had to catch a hockey game while in Toronto. Even if your team is not playing you should try to catch a game!!! The fans were amazing, so welcoming. The food was just never ending choices, and there is not a bad seat in the house...

a first time visit to watch the ice hockey every bit as exciting as I had hoped it would be. Guests in the platinum lounge it was a terrific evening, lots of action and a win for the home team.The dinner eaten in the bar area was probably the best filet mignon we had during our trip, as a...
Went down to see the Raptors play a game. Very nice building and atmosphere. The team didn't disappoint either as they won!

Great experience always at the ACC. Been here for many Toronto Raptors Games including Toronto Maple Leaf Games, including the Playoffs for both teams. Also been here for some concerts like Drake. Great venue and one of the best in all of North America.
Seen the Leafs play here a dozen times. TONS of food options now offered, and I love that you can find a bit of everything.
Went for the Raptors' game. As a fans, nothing is more important than the team you support won. The hotdog and the beer became less important though they were served in a reasonable price.

An amazing entertainment experience, great sight lines for every event. Hockey games are great, The Toronto Maple Leafs are exciting to watch and the Basketball team Toronto Raptors and Lacrosse team Toronto Rock make up the teams that call The ACC home. Many big celebrity musicians such as Rush, Bon Jovi, Celine Dion have graced the stage for concerts.

Visited the city with friends to see game of thrones concert. Very impressive surroundings with great acoustics.good visibility to the entire arena. Good services and facilities. Easy walking distance of downtown hotels. Well lit outside for walking public. Very nice seats for a two hour concert,few distractions. Definitely a must see.

Had the best time ever at the ACC. Although the Raptors lost in game 6 it was a wonderful time. Then we ended our weekend trip with a Carrie Underwood concert. Which you haven't lived until you've seen this woman in concert. She truly has the voice of an angel. If you ever get a chance to take in a...
We sat second row up from the ice. We had a server that was always checking on us. Always enjoy the ACC. Unfortunately the Leafs lost to the Habs

watched a leaf game on a Wednesday evening with my son. The tickets were free, and so was the parking, so the experience started off just the way I like it- cheapIt was well worth visiting, I would suggest everyone to go at least once. the venue is fantastic and comfortable and the leafs won...
First leafs game in decades (i live in the west), great sports venue and the leafs won - staff were friendly and lots of signage getting there from Union station
Great experience, all should do this at least once in your lifetime, even if not a Leafs Fan. Total exuberance, the crowd really gets into the game. An experience you will not forget.
I love the ACC, I have been attending concerts there for yrs. The sound system rocks. All the greats play here and I am there to see them.

As with my previous review from March '16 the same review pretty much stands this time around for my annual pilgrimage across the pond from the UK to see the Leafs play for 3 home games and 1 Marlies game on family day, date range for reviews are from 20th Feb - 25th Feb '17.The ACC is a great...

The ACC is a good venue for seeing the Maple Leafs, Raptors, and concerts too, but if you want to feed a family or pick up a few drinks, it's going to hit you in the wallet LARGE!!!! Parking ranges from $25-$35 for the event, so if you can Uber or TTC it, that's a good way to go.

A great venue for hockey, concerts and basketball. Decent sound system for sports events and the atmosphere is lots of fun. Food and drinks are very expensive inside the ACC so eat before you come. Ticket prices are a bit steep even for the 300 level seats depending on the event.

Most bigger concerts in Toronto are held here because of its size, not because of its acoustics. Sit fairly close directly in front of the stage or you will hear sound echoing that could hurt your experience there.
This was a bucket list item. We debated a long time before deciding to go. We had great seats but I thought the price was a bit steep.

If you get a chance to watch a game or concert here, do it! This venue hosts the leafs and the Toronto Raptors. Great seats all around and tickets prices aren't too bad. Go support the team and visit the ACC soon

Air Canada Centre is the home of the Toronto Maple Leafs hockey team and the Toronto Raptors basketball teamIt is also the venue for many concerts and ice reviewsThere are no obstructed seats in the building so sight lines are ok from anywhereBe aware that hockey. Tickets are very expensive if you can find any

Whilst in Toronto I was lucky enough to watch the RAPTORS play with my other half. Although the ACC is huge, it was easy to get around with plenty of staff around to help. As there are so many entrances (which are thankfully numbered clearly), it didn't take us long to get in, through a quick security check and seated....

Awesome building, great sound system, not a bad seat in the house! Been here for Raptors and Leafs games and multiple concerts over the years. Right in the heart of downtown Toronto. Make sure to hit up Real Sports before or after the event!

We saw the Toronto Raptors win a really tense match. The atmosphere was absolutely brilliant. The audience were the stars with prizes, a dance off, cheerleaders encouraging as much noise as possible and all done in typical Toronto style. Not one cross word uttered within earshot, the toilets and food areas were spotless and staff so helpful and friendly. This...
Great place to catch a hockey or basketball game and even concerts. Get off at Union station and a short walk away.

We went to see the Raptors play, and it was far cheaper than seeing the Maple Leafs and incredibly fun! Drinks prices were okay for a stadium ($12 for a beer).It was chaotic getting in, but once in it was pretty easy to find your way around.Stay clear of the shop afterwards, its mayhem!

The Air Canada Centre is always a good a place to watch sports and go to concerts. I am a season seat holder for the Toronto Raptors and always look forward to going to the games. The lineups may seem long at times however they move really quick. Be ready to spend a bit of money whether it be a...
This is a great arena with many food and beverage options. Tickets are expensive but worth it. Its easy to access from Union Station.
Recently went to the Red Hot Chili Peppers concert at ACC. Seems like a great place for a concert. Not too bad of a seat anywhere!

Was given tickets to a leaf game for a sat and we had a great time. Lots of food choices and drinks choices something for everyone. The staff is very helpful and kind. The location is great, within easy walking distance from Union station.Watched the Leafs play here and was surprised at the venue after being to NHL games in other venues. The staff were friendly and helpful but the arena itself just didn't measure up to my expectations. We also sat quite high up and the atmosphere was terrible (something I...

Love the leafs so kinda have to love the ACC. There is a good leafs, raptors store on the main level with lots of stuff to choose from. At most games they have a on sale item and often discounted racks which you can sometimes find a good deal. Lots of variety of food and alcohol but it is PRICEY....
Way to funny, love this guy, an excellent concert with great friends and excellent hotel. We had an awesome time in Toronto.

Watched the Red Hot Chili Pepper concert. Sound was awesome. Seating pretty good. View of stage was great from our seats but pretty sure they would all be pretty decent. Easy to access the facility and find your way around. Lots of parking nearby and of course Union Station is very near.

Of course we lost,(not by that much) which was embarrassing for me as a NYer in the Raptors city. Anyhow, this venue is exceptional and reminded me a lot of the Barclay Center in Brooklyn. Various liquors and fast foods are available as well as team merchandise. It is in a central location that is easily accessible by car or...

Our hotel was very near to the Air Canada Centre, so as we passed the box office most days we decide to buy tickets for a home game the Maple Leafs, wow what an experience, it was brilliant, fun for the whole family. If your in Toronto when there is a game on, then go you won't be disappointed.

My son and I attended a Raptor's game at the ACC for both our first times. I planned ahead to make this a great experience and MLSE and the ACC did not let me down. There were so many great interaction opportunities. My son took advantage of as many as he could. Even got a high five from some Raptor's...
Mainly the reason we visit the ACC is for the Raptors Game vs Orlando Magics. Great place to be, little expensive food but worth it. It even got Timmy inside the centre.

Recently went to the ACC to see Jeff Dunham. I thought the stage area was poorly displayed but I can't say that this is the fault of ACC or Jeff's people. The sound was also off, could not hear the total act clearly. We had very good seats and still experienced these issues.
Saw the Raptors vs Bucks. The ambiance was great. We ate at the Draght Deck before the game and the food was good. We ate chicken fingers and a roast beef sandwich.

I've visited the ACC on many occasions, and love how organized the staff are at handling large crowds.The ACC is also attached to the GO Train system, making it very easy to commute to and fro from the suburbs of Toronto.
We watched a raptors game and had an amazing experience! The seats are pretty narrow with tiny leg room but other than that everything was great. Quite the show!
Go raptors go!!! Best sporting venue in Canada!!!This arena is full of history, and there is no bad seat in the stadium.
Would have rather seen a Raptors game but the Arena was. Ice and had some good food. Shame the Leafs lost to those bum Rangers! As Mickey Mantle once said: "Do I have something in my eye?"
Had a blast at the raptors game we were lucky enough to sit in a suite!! Everything was great but the lady who was helping us had a bit of an attitude but either then that all was good
Been to many events here over the years (Raptors, Leafs & concerts) and sat in many different sections. Decent sight lines from the upper deck, concessions can get a bit pricey but that's everywhere.

Saw the world junior match between Russia and Denmark. Our seats were pretty high, but still had a good view of the ice. The pizza was reasonably priced for a sports stadium, so can't complain. Signage and staff are also helpful, so all good.

Good location and decent service. There are lots of shops and lots of choices for food and drink. There is also a nice restaurant at one end of the facility if you want a good meal. Of course everything is expensive throughout the entire building.The further away you park the cheaper the cost.

Went to see a raptors game with one of my sales reps. The game was a blowout so not much suspense there. It was against the 76ers without Embiid. I found the service down there not to be that great and the seats were still tight. I can't really complain to much since the tickets were comped but expected more...
If you're in Toronto, try and see at least one game here. The atmosphere is amazing! The beer is quite expensive though but that's what you get for a stadium I guess!

Great sporting venue, great show. My first ever basketball game. Really enjoyed it. Family friendly atmosphere. Pumping music, pyrotechnics, it had it all. Only downside it was expensive compared to say a UK football game. Lots of stoppages. Arena and experience was really good though.
Well, it is a sporting event venue, so certainly got what we asked for there.Drinks are ultra expensive - $19 for a glass of wine. And it wasn't something I'd rush to the liquor store for either.

I have seen several Toronto Raptor's games at the ACC and its a great venue no matter where you sit! Also- Raptor's games are so much fun. Highly recommend you check one out. Beware of expensive beer and food prices though!

The ACC is an easy place to access. Easy to park or get there by subway or train.It's clean and comfortable, so watching an event is great. In my opinion the acoustics could be better. Overall I enjoy watching any big event at the Air Canada Centre.
I had an outstanding experience with family at the Air Canada Centre while watching the raptors. Very family friendly venue!

I say that it really depends what you watch and how much you pay. Like all sport attractions and musicall stuff, the more money you pay, the better experience you will get. I am a student and never had the crazy seats, so all my settings were in the top 1 to 2 rows of the acc. This meant I...
Enjoyed a fun and entertaining Lacrosse game. Never disappoints. The fans and the atmosphere sucks you in.
Live sports and concerts at the Air Canada Centre. Ticket kiosks available for purchases on site . Everything from hockey to best known artists/groups. Worth a trip to see this centre.

Home to the Maple Leafs (ice hockey) and Raptors (NBA basketball), this sporting venue is adept in hosting sporting event and it shows that expertise during our visit for our first NBA game. Always a great time at the Raps Game - the vibe in the ACC is fantastic for Raptors games. The food is actually getting better and the beers - well it is what it is - gunna pay large for them. Overall a great venue to watch concerts, sports and other activities. The platinum lounge is also a favourite spot.
This is an excellent place to watch a hockey game, we had very good seats and enjoyed the game very much Easy access to everything in the Arena
Love the Air Canada Centre. It is great for seeing a game. All seats are good, it is a well organized venue. Parking is across the road, but there is a lot nearby that may be a bit cheaper.
It's always a good time to go see the Leafs. Had dinner at the club level. It was good but pricey.Location is great and easily accessible by transit. Parking is always a challenge.

unforgettable experience! to be a fan of Toronto Raptors is a privilege, but I guess is the same feeling for any other NBA fan ... being an italian 2nd division soccer fan is different ... maybe more "physical" ... but I will recommend anyone to enjoy such experience ... real fun, real first class athlets ... real first class organization...

The vibe here is awesome, what I'll say is that it's bigger on the inside than the outside! they also have a free fanzone out side but GET THERE EARLY! I was there in Basketball season when the Raptors and the Blue Jays won on the same day so it doesn't get much better.
We had a great time going to the hockey game. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is comfortable seating and lots of (understandably overpriced) food and merchandise.
Price for tickets were great as two lower ranked teams. Bring lots of money if you want a drink (pop is $5.00, hotdog $11.00, beer start at $11,00). Great atmosphere all around,

Bene to over half of the hockey arenas in the NHL, and this one was one of the best to watch a game. Good, clean and nice place for being around much longer than some of the arenas. For a Monday night game vs an Eastern Conference team the atmosphere was great.

The ACC is a decent hockey arena, with good visibility from everywhere and rapid ingress and egress. The seat are OK for a hockey venue (less so for a concert). Prices for snacks and beverages are THROUGH THE ROOF. Eat well before or after, and avoid paying through the nose.
I saw the Maple Leafs played against the Anaheim Ducks their last game in town for the year nice stadium the bartenders in the executive lounge were really hot!! :)

The ACC is so easy to navigate and access from any point from the street. Once inside there are happy cheery staff everywhere offering assistance. The arena itself is an arena, we've been for basketball (and concerts). But there so many bathrooms that you never really wait and it's clean!!! Food options everywhere, food court grade except the prices are...
Staff very friendly and welcoming. Drinks and food are expensive as they are at any major sporting venue. Family atmosphere and loving the ice hockey.... we don't have this in Scotland.

Love coming here for sporting events. Lots of food bathrooms and things to do in and around the arena. Staff is very friendly and helpful. You don't wait to long in line which is a bonus during the cold winter months.

Came for 2 US games, left both very happy (US won)! Great experience. As with all sports venues, the prices were a little high, but the US/CA exchange rate helped ease the pain a little bit. Both nights we had very friendly ushers who appeared to really like their jobs - that makes a huge difference!

I watched a basketball game there and it was very entertaining. I highly recommend to not only sport funds to visit the arena on any sporting event.

I enjoy this venue for both sporting events and concerts. I find the acoustics are better seated in the lower bowl or on the floor level for concerts but sitting in the upper bowl is excellent for watching hockey and seeing all the action. Staff here are always pleasant and knowledgeable.
its a beautiful stadium there was plenty of parking around the stadium...very close to the lake as well

Been to lots of events at many venues over the years and Toronto always ranks the best. Great people, friendly, helpful and the layout is the best. Now it is a tad expensive to see games and concerts but that's the only downside to this world class facility.

I usually attend 5 or 6 games a year. ACC is a great venue, there are few bad seats. Drink/eat before you go, prices for beer/food is crazy, ($14 for a beer lol). Just watched UFC 206 here from ring side seats and it was spectacular. What a great facility!! Toronto Fans are awesome!!

Seeing a hockey game in person is so much different than watching the game on TV, especially when you have great seats which afford the opportunity to see all the action at both ends of the rink.There is a noise level, also not evident on TV, seeming more like a rock concert at times. Our seats were amazing, getting to the seats was easy. Our views were great. Only downfall was the expensive beer. All other aspects were great.

My wife and I recently had the chance to see the Raptures v Cavaliers at the center. What a night it was. I have been to the Air Canada Centre several times now to see the Maple Leafs play and it's always a great atmosphere.You definitely get an even bigger welcome when other Leaf fans realise you are from the UK!The price of the game tickets are not to bad considering the price of football tickets over here.

I got the opportunity to watch the MN Wild play the Toronto Maple Leafs on 12/7/2016 (MN won). What a great venue. Very friendly staff to show you where to go. Tons of food options and very easy to get around. Had a great experience.
Concerts and sporting events. Been here and done that. A venue perfect for both.A world class venue for world class entertainment.

Replacing and surpassing Maple Leaf Gardens, the Air Canada Centre is a great place to take in hockey, basketball or a concert. I have been to the ACC for basketball, a corporate event, and of course hockey including the World Cup of Hockeyand the ACC never disappoints. Awesome time here, everything is great, except the drinks are rather expensive. But all and all a great arena for a hockey game.

Visited the Air Canada Centre to attend the Pentatonix concert with Abi and Us the Duo.Fabulous experience - everyone was very helpful and the seats were great. I have been here so many times and have always been impressed with what this centre holds. We have been here for basketball games and WeDay. They place is large and always has exciting well put together events and concerts. Check this place out if you are looking for entertainment.

There's not a bad seat in the building, and even standing room is fun with the right people. The only drawbacks are the cost of tickets and the insane prices for concessions. Went there for a NBA match. Raptors vs Sacramento Kings. Wonderful crowd cheering and shouting, really great place.

I am used to sports facilities in Brazil. This is totally different. The whole place is made for you to enjoy the game, and eve. In the cheap seats the view of the court is quite good. It's a shame that the Raptors lost when we attended there!
went here to see the Toronto Raptors v San Lorenzo..great venue and great poutine! and a great atmosphere..seats are quite high up , similar to the O2 in London but I would say smaller!

Had a great night watching the maple leafs. Didn't realise how energetic and at times brutal this sport can be. Every need catered for, even in seat snacks and refreshments. Had such a great night. Can't wait to visit again on our next trip.

Went here to catch the Raptors play the Cavs, and I was impressed with the arena... Depending on why you are there - the ticket prices can be significant. There are LOTS of food places although pricey. On first floor you can get premium wine but the house wines are fine

I like the atmosphere you get with Raptors fans as they really support their team. Much like the TFC down the road, the game is load and action is fresh. If you are going for a show, concert event or to see Raptors or other sports it's a great place, good vibes, good take out type food, beer wine coolers, good views from all seating.

While visiting my son, we bought tickets to a Leafs Game... I had not attended a game since the Gardens closed... A very clean place to go. We saw the Raptors and had a great time. There is a really neat place to eat right there with really good POUTINE... do not miss Poutine (fries with cheese and gravy)
Not a bad seat in this place, a complete entertainment centre. Brand new video screen inside that is incredibly clear and another outside. Seating is comfortable and the amenities are first rate!
We recently attended a World Cup of Hockey game at the ACC. I have e attended many events over the years here and have never been disappointed.
Went to the AC Center to see Adele live in concert. Enjoyed the venue-spacious and acoustics were good.
